titlealts.searchtitle: Supporting Information: Organisation Site Coding Frames - Description

div.p: For further information, see the attribute ORGANISATION SITE CODE.
ORGANISATION SITE CODING FRAMES

li.p: All NHS ORGANISATION SITES are coded using coding frames, as shown in the tables below:

entry.p: Organisation Type Identifier and Site or Sub-Division Identifier

div.p: Example Local Service Provider Site e.g. LSP0101
Example Care Trust Site e.g. TAK01
Also:
Example Independent Sector Healthcare Provider (ISHP) Site e.g. NV701
Example GP Practice Branch Surgery: e.g. H81010002

li.p: H (and length of code) = Organisation Identifier

div.p: Example Commissioning Support Unit Site: e.g. 0AA01
Example Prison: e.g. YDE01
Example Optical Site: e.g. TP01A
Example Care Home Site: e.g. VN01A
Also:
Example Clinical Commissioning Group (CCG) Site e.g. 11AAA - 99YZZ
Example Special Health Authority (SpHA) Site: e.g. T115A
T115A - Organisation Type Identifier and Site or Sub-Division Identifier
The structure and format of ORGANISATION SITE CODES maintained by the Organisation Data Service, NHS Prescription Services and other agencies are detailed in the tables below.
NHS ORGANISATION SITE CODES TABLES
Coding Formats
Table 1: CODING FORMATS FOR ORGANISATION SITES IN ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.p: First three characters denote owning Care Trust
First three characters denote owning Clinical Commissioning Group
First three characters denote Executive Agency
First three characters denote Government Department
GP Practice Branch Surgery - England and Wales
First 6 characters denote parent practice. Char 1 = W for Welsh GP Practice.
All other values represent English GP Practices
A, B, D, G, I, K, L, M , N, O, S, U, V, W
First three characters denote owning Independent Sector Healthcare Provider (ISHP)
Note: The A-Y range includes all letters except Z
First three characters denote parent Local Authority
First three characters denote owning NHS Trust
First five characters denote owning Local Service Provider
First three characters denote owning NHS Trust
First three characters denote owning Other Statutory Authority
First three characters denote owning Primary Care Trust

p.b: All Primary Care Trusts closed 31 March 2013

entry.p: The characters do NOT denote any ownership.
First three characters denote owning SHA Trust

p.b: All Strategic Health Authorities closed 31 March 2013 - from 1 April 2013 referred to as High Level Health Geography Site

p.i: Note: Codes for Executive Agency, Executive Agency Programme, Executive Agency Site and Executive Agency Programme Department do not easily fit into the coding frames as shown above and are therefore not included. This is due to their unusual structure in that there are more hierarchical 'tiers' than with other organisations.

Executive Agency and Executive Agency Programme are both considered Organisation level entities, although each Programme does have a relationship to an Executive Agency. Executive Agency codes are three characters long. Executive Agency Programme codes are six, and their first three characters are the same as the Executive Agency they are associated to.

Department codes of eight characters long can then be allocated underneath a Programme code (sharing the first six characters). Executive Agency Site codes of five characters long can be allocated under an Executive Agency code (and share the first three characters).

div.i: Note: A-9 indicates that characters A-Z and 0-9 are valid: except B, I, O, S, U and Z (to avoid ambiguity). This applies to all ORGANISATION SITE CODES in the Coding Format Table above except Independent Sector Healthcare Provider
div.p: Table 2: CODING FORMATS FOR ORGANISATION SITES IN OTHER HOME COUNTRIES

entry.p: Primary Healthcare Directorate (Isle of Man) Site

p.i: Note: A-9 indicates that characters A-Z and 0-9 are valid: except B, I, O, S, U and Z (to avoid ambiguity).
